author: __flcl
content: Just for a note: it could be great to have some of the nodes running on legacy CPUs next devnet

author: parithosh
content: We mainly use Digital ocean for running the devnets, i dont think you have fine grained control on what CPU you end up with there. Is there some cloud provider and CPU type you wanted us to integrate?

author: 0xtylerholmes_
content: Could we get minimal presets working for the EL clients? It uses a different trusted setup with a smaller FIELD_ELEMENTS_PER_BLOB. I looked at geth and it would need some work to support. I'm not sure about the other ELs.

author: g11tech
content: these are hardcoded at kzg lib level, unless there is a kzg lib with minimal preset this wouldn't be possible

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> you can compile c-kzg with minimal preset

author: __flcl
content: 4th gen Intel CPUs like 4790k will fail in case ckzg is compiled with adx support

author: __flcl
content: <@206016661470314496>  might be you have some specific cloud providers in mind?

author: 0xtylerholmes_
content: Gotcha, the way geth accesses the API then should be safe then as long as I compile minimal support with c-kzg and use a minimal trusted_setup? I'll need to check how geth loads the trusted_setup for ckzg. Not sure if geth initializes the trusted_setup or if c-kzg does. Do you know if anyone is doing this on any of the other ELs?

author: potuz
content: We'll need these to be runtime selectable to pass spectests when they are available, or are spec tests going to be made on one preset only?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<gakonst> > <gakonst>  replying to: 
 ```@testing4844_bot wrote: 
 <FLCL> Just for a note: it could be great to have some of the nodes running on legacy CPUs next devnet```
 This is a very interesting point. Are you worried about DoS on lower end machines due to the math?
